body:
Hi.
I'm not a contributor of this project, but i'm also using this speech dataset.
From your name I think you're italian like I am, and so probably we're using the same dataset portion
Instead of using the m-AIlabs loader to load this, i just adjusted the samplerate in the json file and merged the metadata file for all the books in a singol one, then did the same with all the wavs, and in that case the ljspeech loader worked and didn't trow any errors.
Hope this helps.

Hi and thanks for the reply. ( and yes..i'm italian )
As i wrote, i managed to solve the issue changing a line of code in file preprocess.py. I opened this thread only for let the developers known about this "possible" issue.
My problem is that after 400 steps of the first Epoch it rise an error: CUDA out of memory
( actually i'm training this dataset on my i7 6600K with a GTX 1070 8Gb )
i still can't understand if there's some parameters to adjust or if i'm doing something wrong...
Hope that you have more luck than me!
Regards

Hi.
They say, in the requirements, that with batch size 32 you need like 9.1 gb of memory, so i think you could try reducing the batch size, i'm not sure about the 32 though because i can't read  the exact thing now, so don't take my words as granted.
I am training my model on a tesla k80 wich has like 22 gb of memory, so I didn't have this issue, i'm using it in an azure vm.
By the way, just out of curiosity, are you training with Riccardo Fasol?
I find his voice really awesome, so I'm training with his data in hope to produce a really great italian voice to read audiobooks!
Anyway, hope this helps, have a good day.
@massimo1980 you need to set meta_files field in config.json as '''null''. I guess you missed that and therefore it did not work.

@erogol 
Hi,
i'm sorry if i'm bother you ( i'm using this thread without opening a new one ). Just for curiosity:
I've successfully trained italian dataset of M-AILABS to 115K steps. 
On my PC setup ( i7 6600k + GTX 1070 ) the demo server works really nice and the quality of the TTS voice is good! Just for testing pourposes, i was tryin to use the trained model on a Raspberry Pi. My goal is to implement the use of a neural stick to see the response time.
If i try to run the server i got this errors:

python3.7 server/server.py -c server/conf.json 
 > Loading TTS model ...
 | > model config:  results/mailabs/config.json
 | > model file:  checkpoint_115000.pth.tar
 > Setting up Audio Processor...
 | > sample_rate:16000
 | > num_mels:80
 | > min_level_db:-100
 | > frame_shift_ms:12.5
 | > frame_length_ms:50
 | > ref_level_db:20
 | > num_freq:2049
 | > power:1.5
 | > preemphasis:0.98
 | > griffin_lim_iters:60
 | > signal_norm:True
 | > symmetric_norm:False
 | > mel_fmin:0
 | > mel_fmax:8000.0
 | > max_norm:1.0
 | > clip_norm:True
 | > do_trim_silence:True
 | > n_fft:4096
 | > hop_length:200
 | > win_length:800
 > Using model: Tacotron2
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "server/server.py", line 14, in <module>
    synthesizer = Synthesizer(config)
  File "/Users/maxxam/PROGETTI-PERSONALI/TTS/server/synthesizer.py", line 31, in __init__
    self.load_tts(self.config.tts_path, self.config.tts_file, self.config.tts_config, config.use_cuda)
  File "/Users/maxxam/PROGETTI-PERSONALI/TTS/server/synthesizer.py", line 58, in load_tts
    self.tts_model.load_state_dict(cp['model'])
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/torch/nn/modules/module.py", line 845, in load_state_dict
    self.__class__.__name__, "\n\t".join(error_msgs)))
RuntimeError: Error(s) in loading state_dict for Tacotron2:
	Missing key(s) in state_dict: "decoder.attention.query_layer.linear_layer.weight", "decoder.attention.inputs_layer.linear_layer.weight", "decoder.attention.v.linear_layer.weight", "decoder.attention.v.linear_layer.bias". 
	Unexpected key(s) in state_dict: "decoder.attention_layer.query_layer.linear_layer.weight", "decoder.attention_layer.inputs_layer.linear_layer.weight", "decoder.attention_layer.v.linear_layer.weight", "decoder.attention_layer.v.linear_layer.bias". 
	size mismatch for embedding.weight: copying a param with shape torch.Size([130, 512]) from checkpoint, the shape in current model is torch.Size([129, 512]).

am i doing something wrong ?
tnx for your patience!

Regards
Massimo
I am facing the same problem as @massimo1980. Any updates?

> @massimo1980 you need to set meta_files field in config.json as '''null''. I guess you missed that and therefore it did not work.

@erogol I don't think that's the problem.
I'm training on the french portion of the dataset and I got the same problem even with both meta_files values to null.

```
"datasets":   // List of datasets. They all merged and they get different speaker_ids.
        [
            {
                "name": "mailabs",
                "path": "../mailabs",
                "meta_file_train": null,
                "meta_file_val": null
            }
        ]
```

and I got 

`ValueError: zero-size array to reduction operation maximum which has no identity`

EDIT: I just realised that I have the same error but not the same problem since the variable csv_files is not empty

EDIT2: It was the speaker_regex that wasn't right for me, it's working fine now

> > @massimo1980 you need to set meta_files field in config.json as '''null''. I guess you missed that and therefore it did not work.
> 
> @erogol I don't think that's the problem.
> I'm training on the french portion of the dataset and I got the same problem even with both meta_files values to null.
> 
> ```
> "datasets":   // List of datasets. They all merged and they get different speaker_ids.
>         [
>             {
>                 "name": "mailabs",
>                 "path": "../mailabs",
>                 "meta_file_train": null,
>                 "meta_file_val": null
>             }
>         ]
> ```
> 
> and I got
> 
> `ValueError: zero-size array to reduction operation maximum which has no identity`
> 
> EDIT: I just realised that I have the same error but not the same problem since the variable csv_files is not empty
> 
> EDIT2: It was the speaker_regex that wasn't right for me, it's working fine now

Have you successfully trained your model on french?
Yeah, It's not perfect though. I still have problems with ponctuation and some special letters and combination of letters ("รง", "echo"...). I'm gonna try to train a character based model.

Nice, would you mind sharing the resulting model? I have been trying to find a trained model since I can't afford any good gpu to train TTS on french mailabs. I would also suggest patching specific syllables ie. "รง" becomes "ss".
Yeah sure, I'll wait for the release of [this](https://github.com/mozilla/TTS/issues/501#issuecomment-695195474) first because I haven't successfully trained a vocoder for this speaker yet.
Do you guys use the correct function for phonemes? basic_cleaner.

> Do you guys use the correct function for phonemes? basic_cleaner.

What's "basic_cleaner" ? I can't find a mention of it in the TTS project
`basic_cleaners` in `cleaners.py`. It does not turn special characters to ASCII. You set it in the config.json in the `cleaners` field. Alternatively, you can write your own function.
Oh yeah I completely overlook this part. This is gonna be great for number normalization as well (for now I have to write them in full). Thanks, I'm gonna look into that !
